column8:
Unilever South Central Europe is the marketing and sales operation of Unilever in the Balkans, serving approx. 48 Mil consumers, across 8 countries, having a turnover of approx. 180 Mil euros, with 335 employees.

Role mandate:		
I took over the managing director position in 2009 at a time when the business was severely impacted by the economic crisis.
The key objective was to find new sources of growth by entering new categories like Ice Cream where the business was not present while restructuring the business to be more competitive in the market place.

Achievements:
This strategy delivered strong results: 
-The Ice Cream brands (Algida & Napoca) have reached market leadership after only 2 years.
-The indirect cost base has been reduced from 19 Mil EUR to 15 Mil EUR allowing the company to invest more in the brands. 
-The business transformation exercise has allowed doing this, while improving employees’ engagement from 57% in 2009 to 83% in 2010.

Unilever Francophone West Africa was in 2003 still an integrated business based in Ivory Coast with interests in plantations, palm oil refining, soap and foods manufacturing, marketing and sales operation in 8 countries in the region (Ivory Coast, Senegal, Mali, Niger, Burkina Faso, Benin, Togo and Guinea).The business had a turnover of around 200 Mil EUR with more than 1500 employees.
The political situation and the lax regulatory regime following the failed coup d’etat of 2002 impacted severely the market position of the company.

Role mandate:
My priority was to put in place an emergency plan to stop value destruction.
The key thrusts were:
-Exit non-strategic activities and manage the business for cash
-Refocus on the core
-Reduction of indirect costs
-Rejuvenation of the leadership team and building a “Win with Customers” mind-set.

Achievements:
-By 2008 the business was back to growth (+20%), the indirect costs had been reduced by 45% and the operating profit was reaching 12%.

Unilever Hong Kong was a business unit with a turnover of 84 Mil EUR and 168 employees. The business was however impacted by a slowdown in the economy after the return to China in 1997. 

Role mandate:
The key priority was to rebuild a ''Can Do'' attitude within the team

Achievements:
-Building an entrepreneurial culture through passion for winning (“One step ahead”) empowerment and definition of individual scorecards for each employees.
-Strong innovation programme supported by a 3 horizon process with entry in 3 new categories (Ice cream, hair and deodorants)
-Simplification of the distribution network (from 13 to 2 distributors)
-This allowed us to return to profitable growth with a growth of 9% in 1999, 6% in 2000 and 9,6% in 2001 despite a depressed economy and a very competitive business environment.
